title: Being An Only Child - Gregway
description:
Greg grew up an only child. Was it the worst or best thing ever!?

SUBSCRIBE/LIKE/SHARE/MERCH: http://www.districtlines.com/gameovergreggy

Leave your questions for Greg as a video response and check back every Wednesday and Friday to see what he's saying.

Subscribe to our channel: http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=gameovergreggy

The Vlog playlist: http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLOlEpGVXWUVv1g9oZi6O95CwRHQd0ulT6

Follow Greg on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/gameovergreggy

transcript_chunks.text: what's up everybody Welcome to Gregway today's Gregway topic comes from Brand Range of course rambling with Range you know him from Game Podcast Beyond he's a fan of the Greg Miller products the whole line of Greg Miller products as you know he asked me what's it like being an only child and there's no easy answer to that right like it's it's all I've ever known I don't know you talk to people with siblings and sometimes they love it sometimes they hate it being an only child you just you know what you know right like it was weird growing up like I you know I definitely I was spoiled first off like you know what I mean like you've heard my dumb stories about WWF Royal Rumble and all these other things like my parents and aunt and uncle like they took care of me incredibly well entire family you know spoiled me not rotten CU I'm still a good kid but anything I ever I never really wanted for anything right because there was nobody else to worry about screw everybody else

family you know spoiled me not rotten CU I'm still a good kid but anything I ever I never really wanted for anything right because there was nobody else to worry about screw everybody else I'm the I'm Not only was I the only child right in the family tree right like on my mom's side her sister aunt and uncle they had no kids and then over my dad's side there were other children's cousins you call them in a family tree but they were older than me so I was kind of like everybody's last one anyway no nobody really cared much about it so being an only child was you know I didn't want for anything and then there were you know I I probably played with action figures for too long I remember I remember the first girlfriend I ever had in high school I brought her over and I was like showing her my room and touring and then I was like oh and here's where I keep my toys and here's where I keep my action figures she like what I was like oh do normal High School freshmen not have a

"Hey, my room and touring, and then I was like, 'Oh, and here's where I keep my toys,' and here's where I keep my action figures. She's like, 'What?' And I'm like, 'Oh, do normal high school freshmen not have a drawer full of Superman and Batman action figures?' Where they're like... she's like, 'No.' I'm like, 'Huh? I do that's how I live.' Um, but yeah, it was all right. I mean, there you know, there was I liked being an only child. I liked having nice things and everything else. And the kids I always saw who had siblings, they always had like the extreme it seemed right. Like, there's one kid I went to school with, Eric, he had like five other brothers right? And so their house was just a train wreck all the time. It was just kids screaming. There was always another baby like... he you know, there was like he never felt like he was getting enough time or whatever it felt like or stuff like that. I don't know. Of course, this is in the moment. God only knows how it feels now. I'm sure they're all lumberjacks or professional football players."

enough time or whatever it felt like or stuff like that I don't know of course this is in the moment God only knows how it feels now I'm sure they're all lumberjacks or professional football team but there's pluses and minuses to each I imagine right like on my side there's definitely times where you're like it would be cool to have a little brother or an older brother or somebody to teach you stuff not to teach you how to dress right God knows I didn't know what I was doing when I stopped wearing school uniforms um but overall you you know you just learn like anything else you know I think it was more lonely maybe at times but it wasn't terrible I I definitely made a lot of dumb shows in the basement on the video camera like this where I would talk to him and that seems to have paid off pretty well for me so unless that other family of six is a professional football team I think I panned out all right being an only child's kind of cool so there you have it ladies and gentlemen

Being an only child's kind of cool, so there you have it, ladies and gentlemen, another Game Over Greggy in the books. Remember every Wednesday and Friday I'm here answering your questions or just ranting about whatever the hell I feel like because I have that ability. The whole point of these shows is to use the Game Over Greggy to make your day.
